link module¶

link module¶

Module to handle links¶

The goal of this module is to handle the links objects The class link is able to transmit messages emulating delays

class link.Link(env, node, resource, properties)[source]¶

Bases: object

Class defining a link between nodes this class contains properties for the link like delay or preference and link policy functions Every link have a unique id A single link can have a specific id

DELAY = 'delay'¶
POLICY_FUNCTION = 'policy'¶
__init__(env, node, resource, properties)[source]¶

Creates a link and automatically assign a uniqueid to the link It requires a simpy environment where to operate. It also require a simpy resource to operate correctly and reserve the channel for a message.

Parameters

  • env – Simpy environment

  • node – Node which the link is refered to

  • resource – unitary resource used to lock the link

  • properties – properties of the link in the graphml that needs to be evaluated

property delay¶

Returns the delay distribution that needs to be used for the link :returns: link delay distribution

property id¶

Returns the link id :returns: id of the link

property node¶

Returns the referenced node :returns: node reference

test(policy_value: policies.PolicyValue) → policies.PolicyValue[source]¶

test. Test if a policy value is applicable to the policy function of the link

Parameters

policy_value (PolicyValue) – policy value to test

Return type

PolicyValue

transmit(msg: Any, delay: float) → None[source]¶

Actual transmitting function

Parameters

  • msg – message that needs to be trasfered

  • delay – time that needs to be waited before the message arrives to the destination

tx(msg, delay)[source]¶

Transmission function fot the node use this function to trigger a simpy process :param msg: message that needs to be transfered :param delay: delay that needs to be waited
